content: Amiodarone usage leads to changes in serum thyroid hormone levels, with typical alterations including decreased serum T3, increased serum T4 and reverse T3 levels, along-side normal or slightly elevated serum TSH [ 117 ]. Early elevations in serum TSH, often dose- and time-dependent, tend to normalize within a few months [ 118 ]. The impact of amiodarone on thyroid function stems from both inherent drug effects and its iodine content, although the latter alone does not account for the entire range of thyroid-related abnormalities observed in patients initiated on this medication [119,120]. 5.4.1
